turn.0: ELIF: Why women don't do jobs like shovelling snow, dig coals from underground mines, or clean sewers, and yet unfairly demand equal pay?
turn.1: 1) Show me those stats. 2) Yes it is. The act of doing the job and the outcome of the job are two separate things.
turn.2: So, you agree that the pay should be based on the outcome. If the outcome is less than a man, then the pay should be less than a man. It is only fair.
turn.3: No I said the opposite of that.
turn.4: Then it is not fair, isn't it? You are demanding equal pay for an unequal outcome.
turn.5: I'm not demanding anything. I think equal pay for each person doing the same job makes sense.  Are you suggesting all jobs should be paid in a similar scheme to commission based jobs? That would probably be too big an overhaul of the system, too difficult to monitor etc.
